sentences.en: a short and turbulent career in politics
But his heart was in a constant, turbulent riot.
sentences.cn: 但是他的内心却经常处于激荡不安之中.

sentences.en: Fluidization has had a rather turbulent history.
sentences.cn: 流态化的发展历史是颇不平坦的.

sentences.en: He has had a turbulent political career.
sentences.cn: 他的政治生涯动荡不定。

sentences.en: His heart was in a constant, turbulent riot.
sentences.cn: 他的内心却经常处于激荡不安之中.

sentences.en: His turbulent private life has received wide publicity.
sentences.cn: 他那乱糟糟的私生活已受到广泛的注意.

sentences.en: I had to have a boat that could handle turbulent seas.
sentences.cn: 我必须有一艘能经得起狂风骇浪的船。

sentences.en: It contained something which the turbulent nations needed.
sentences.cn: 它依然包含着动乱的民族不可缺少的东西.

sentences.en: It is still in the turbulent years of adolescence.
sentences.cn: 它还处在青春活力汹涌澎湃的年代.

sentences.en: Numerous and extensive eddy cavities retard the turbulent mixing process.
sentences.cn: 多而大的涡流区延迟了扰动的混合过程.

sentences.en: The behavior of convective motion is not laminar but turbulent.
sentences.cn: 对流运动的行为不是片流式而是湍流式.

sentences.en: the dark turbulent waters of the river
The natural wind is turbulent or gusty.
sentences.cn: 自然风的特性是紊乱或阵息的.

sentences.en: The present international situation remains tense and turbulent.
sentences.cn: 当前的国际局势依然紧张动荡.

sentences.en: The seas grew turbulent, tossing the small boat like a cork.
sentences.cn: 海浪变得汹涌澎湃，把小船像漂浮的软木塞一样抛来甩去。

sentences.en: the turbulent times of the French Revolution
sentences.cn: 法国大革命的动荡时期

sentences.en: The water of the channel is quite turbulent.
sentences.cn: 水道中的水体是十分紊乱的.

words.tran_cn: 汹涌澎湃地；动荡地，骚动地
[分化] 浊度；浑浊；混浊度；混乱
骚乱，动荡；[流] 湍流；狂暴

trans.tran_cn: 骚乱的，混乱的，激流的，湍流的，吵闹的，强横的
trans.tran_en: a turbulent situation or period of time is one in which there are a lot of sudden changes
